author: Dan Strumpf
title: Xiaomi Cuts IPO Valuation Target to $70 Billion to $80 Billion
text:
HONG KONG—Xiaomi Corp., the Chinese smartphone maker gearing up for an initial public offering, is aiming for a valuation of between $70 billion and $80 billion, according to people familiar with the matter. The target is lower than the $100 billion that was previously discussed by people familiar with the IPO plans.
Xiaomi—whose IPO is expected to be the world’s biggest by a tech company this year—didn’t disclose the offering size or expected valuation in its May 3 filing announcing the plan to list in Hong Kong. The company...
